title: KKR pulls second Australian float in eight days
text:
PropertyGuru's $1 billion-plus Australian sharemarket float has been cancelled after a bookbuild to take bids from institutional investors.

Street Talk understands PropertyGuru's owners were opted to pull the deal on Wednesday morning after talking to bookrunners Credit Suisse and UBS, who spent the past month marketing to fund managers before running a bookbuild this week.

Funds were notified by the brokers prior to lunch on Wednesday.

The owners blamed anti-technology sector sentiment globally, which has impacted the share prices of tech stocks in Australia and offshore.

PropertyGuru, which is an Asia-focused real estate listings business, had been seeking to raise $340 million to $380.2 million in a deal that would value it at $1.16 billion to $1.36 billion.

It is the second Australian float in eight days cancelled by private equity giant KKR. The firm was also one of Latitude Financial Group's three big shareholders that opted to withdraw a proposed listing last week.
description: PropertyGuru's $1 b illion-plus sharemarket float has been cancelled after a bookbuild to take bids from institutional investors.
